name: Movies About Merry Olde England Quiz / Test | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Errol Flynn often appeared in seagoing adventure stories set in Olde England. Which of the following is NOT one of his?
questions.explanation:
The Lion in Winter.

	That one is Peter O'Toole. Flynn is a seagoing adventurer in the other three.

questions.text: Flynn also starred in 'The Adventures of Robin Hood'. In the movie, how was he lured into a trap?
questions.explanation:
Archery Contest.

	The prize was offered by Olivia DeHaviland.

questions.text: Henry VIII is a popular figure in classic movies. Who starred as Henry in 'The Private Life of Henry VIII'?
questions.explanation:
Charles Laughton.

	Great actor. Rathbone and Rains were in Flynn's 'Robin Hood'.

questions.text: King Arthur is another popular movie figure. Who played King Arthur in 'Camelot'?
Robert Taylor starred as 'Ivanhoe'. How was he injured in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Jousting at a tournament.

	Good film. Taylor's best?

questions.text: Cromwell is another famous figure from English history. Who played the deposed (and ultimately beheaded) king in the movie of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Alec Guinness.

	Guinness played King Charles I alongside Richard Harris as Oliver Cromwell.  It was not a great movie overall.

questions.text: 'Becket' starred Richard Burton and Peter O'Toole as two men in conflict. How did the movie end?
questions.explanation:
Becket dies.

	Top acting by both.

questions.text: Speaking of Burton, who played opposite him in 'Anne of the Thousand Days'?
Another movie about olde England was 'The Virgin Queen'. To whom did the title refer?
Harking back to King Arthur, Bing Crosby starred as 'A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court'. Who played opposite him?
